name: ANGINO & ROVNER, P.C., Appellant v. JEFFREY R. LESSIN & ASSOCIATES P.C. and Monsour Zarreii a/k/a Michael ZarreII, Appellees
name_abbreviation: Angino & Rovner, P.C. v. Jeffrey R. Lessin & Associates P.C.

parties: ANGINO & ROVNER, P.C., Appellant v. JEFFREY R. LESSIN & ASSOCIATES P.C. and Monsour Zarreii a/k/a Michael ZarreII, Appellees

opinions.text:
ORDER
PER CURIAM
AND NOW, this 22nd day of February, 2017, the appeal is dismissed as having been IMPROVIDENTLY GRANTED.
Justices Donohue and Wecht dissent.
opinions.author: PER CURIAM

attorneys: Richard C. Angino, Esq., Angino & Lutz, P.C., Harrisburg, for Angino & Rovner, P.C., appellant.
Mark Thomas Richter, Esq., Jeffrey R. Lessin & Associates, P.C,, Philadelphia, for Monsour Zareii a/k/a Michael Zarreii, appellee.
casebody.head_matter:
153 A.3d 317
ANGINO & ROVNER, P.C., Appellant v. JEFFREY R. LESSIN & ASSOCIATES P.C. and Monsour Zarreii a/k/a Michael ZarreII, Appellees

Supreme Court of Pennsylvania.
ARGUED: December 6, 2016
DECIDED: February 22, 2017
Richard C. Angino, Esq., Angino & Lutz, P.C., Harrisburg, for Angino & Rovner, P.C., appellant.
Mark Thomas Richter, Esq., Jeffrey R. Lessin & Associates, P.C,, Philadelphia, for Monsour Zareii a/k/a Michael Zarreii, appellee.
